General examination reveals kyphosis and height loss. Which of the following investigations is the best choice for confirmation of the underlying disorder?

answers.option: DEXA scan of lumber spine and hip

A 40-year-old female patient presents with back pain and extreme weight loss. She was diagnosed with breast cancer 5 years ago but she denied chemotherapy or any other form of treatment. What will be the next best investigation?

The doctor examines the child and concludes that the bone age is less than the chronological age and diagnoses the child with constitutional growth delay. The parents are worried about the final height of the child. What would be the best treatment for this child?

answers.option: No treatment and the final height is decreased.
Surgery to increase the height of femur

question: What is the most common diaphyseal tumor?

answers.option: Giant cell tumour of the bone

question: A young gymnast comes to the outpatient department (OPD) with the complaint of lower back pain. The clinician after taking radiographs concluded that there is a defect in the pars interarticularis. What is this condition called?

A patient presents to the outpatient department for the evaluation of his dwarfism. On examination, he has short limbs and a relatively large head. The father also had the same condition. What is your most probable diagnosis?

What will be the method of choice in managing a closed adult femoral shaft fracture?

A 6-year-old came with short stature below the 3rd percentile. His family has short stature from his father's side. He has frontal bossing, depressed nasal bridge, rhizomelia of lower limbs, and has frequent ear infections. He is also found to have kyphosis. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following gases is known to seep out from under houses and leak during construction/digging of earth, and potentially cause lung cancer?

A female G2 P1 presents to the clinic in the 21st week of gestation as she is not feeling fetal movements. On investigation, the fetus seems short-statured. The fetus is delivered at the 28th week of gestation as a stillborn baby and is noticed to have blue sclerae. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 45-year-old man presented to the emergency department with complaints of back pain that had been present for six months. He reported that the pain was worse when at rest and improved with activity. In addition to the back pain, he complained of redness in his left eye. After an investigation, he was diagnosed with ankylosing spondylitis. Which of the following gene is associated with ankylosing spondylitis?
Which of the following diseases is caused by inhalation of sugarcane dust?

A young female presents to the clinic with a history of pain in the small joints of her hands and tightening of her skin for 3 months. She is also having difficulty swallowing and has oral ulcers. On examination, her blood pressure is 140/90 mmHg and she is noted to have a small mouth and epicanthal folds. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 42-year-old male presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of low back pain for the past few years. He also has morning stiffness and pain which mostly stays for 2-3 hours. Currently, he has been experiencing pain in the back of his right ankle, however, there is no history of trauma. Which of the following is the most appropriate investigation to establish the diagnosis?
Which of the following enzymes is used to convert hypoxanthine to xanthine and xanthine to uric acid?
Which of the following is the most common cause of hypoparathyroidism?

A community in a small village in Northern Sindh seeks advice from a public health officer regarding the best source of water to avoid arsenic poisoning. Which one of the following sources of water must be advised against since it is most likely to be polluted with high levels of arsenic?

An 11-year-old girl presents to the clinic with right knee pain for 10 months with no history of trauma. Pain is not limiting her activities. On examination, she is found to be obese. Her right knee appears normal with no tenderness on hip joints. A pelvis radiograph of both hips shows a widening of the proximal femoral epiphyseal growth plate. What is the most likely diagnosis for this patient?

A 7-year-old boy presents with worsening pain in his leg for about four months. His right foot has started to turn inwards while walking resulting in a noticeable limp. A plain radiograph of the hip joint shows a flattened femoral head. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 44-year-old man visits a physician with complaints of chronic productive cough. He has also developed dyspnea on mild exertion lately. Chest X-ray shows small irregular opacities most prominent in the upper poles of the lungs. The man has a history of working in coal mines for 5 years. Which of the following is the most likely disease the physician should suspect?

The use of marble and stones gives an artistic look to the buildings. However, the workers of stone cutting, sandblasting, and ceramic industry are likely to be predisposed to which one of the following diseases?
Which one of the following diseases is caused by exposure to ionizing radiations, x-rays, and radioactive isotopes?

A 50-year-old obese male presents to the clinic with complaints of pain and swelling in the first metatarsophalangeal joint of the left big toe for 2 days. He has a history of alcohol intake for 10 years. The given explanation best corresponds to which of the following?

answers.option: Presence of monosodium urate crystals in synovial fluid

answers.option: He will have more social networking
He will live a happy life
He will have a lesser tendency to develop neuropsychological disturbances

question: Which of the following is the drug of choice in acute gout?

On physical examination, there is no joint swelling, warmth, or deformity. Some joint crepitus is audible on moving the knee. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A biopsy of the mass is done, and microscopic examination shows sheets of closely packed, primitive cells with small, uniform nuclei and only scant cytoplasm. Karyotypic analysis of the tumor cells shows a t(11:22) translocation. What is the most likely diagnosis?

answers.option: Maintaining adequate calcium and vitamin D intake through diet modification and/or supplementation

answers.option: Selectively targets autoimmune lymphocytes to reduce untoward adverse effects

question: Most frequently and severely involved joint in rheumatoid arthritis:

answers.option: Aggressive loss of cartilage matrix by increased osteoclastic activity

answers.option: It is excreted by the kidneys
It is a weak acidic drug.
It inhibits both COX-1 and COX-2 enzymes.
It is a reversible inhibitor of COX-1 and COX-2.
It has much greater anti-thrombotic activity.

answers.option: Start allopurinol and naproxen for 2 months, followed by long-term allopurinol.
Start naproxen and allopurinol for 2 months, followed by long-term naproxen.
No regular medication, treat acute attacks with naproxen.

question: A 58-year-old postmenopausal woman with a family history of osteoporosis asks how to reduce her risk. What is the initial recommendation?

answers.option: Adequate calcium and vitamin D intake through diet or supplements.
